subject: EU customer
description_text:
Hi

I am from europe. I have been following your products for some time. I am
interested in some things.

Do you have a warehouse in the EU? or are you planning to have?
Because it would make it easier for us customers from the EU to shop
because of VAT and thus avoid possible complications with customs and a
long wait for customs to do their job and for the products to be delivered
to us.

I see you don't have a Discord page yet?
That would be useful, because this way we customers can easily connect and
solve possible problems more easily, as well as solving various questions,
with of course the professional supervision of one of the Simsonn experts.

Igor

conversations.body_text:
if you have a warehouse in Germany then it would be desirable to have VAT
calculated for each EU country right away. that way you will start selling
better in the EU faster.
Personally I am on Fanatec V3 pedals and I want to upgrade. but since I am
used to ffb on pedals and riding like that, that is why your new VAM system
is interesting to me, as well as the pedals of course.
I am only a Discord user, and since I have a VRS 20nm wheel, I am regularly
present on their Discord, and if I notice that someone needs help I suggest
it. because I am quite engineering-minded, so I made some innovations on
the wheel myself. but I do not have any organizational influence on the
Discord groups. that requires a lot of effort that no one is willing to pay
for.
Discord is quite important to you if you are seriously thinking of starting
out in that sim racing world. so my advice is to pay someone to run the
Discord group, or to be there as technical support. Once upon a time when I
was considering Moza products, I was also on their Discord group and there
was a guy who was paid for technical support and it all works very well.
the man was very dedicated to the job and the users were extremely
satisfied. I haven't been on Moza discord for a long time because I don't
use their equipment, so I can't confirm if this is still the case with
them. but it is certainly a good recipe for successful support. because
many of them do not understand how to use sim racing equipment, even the
most banal things to adjust, because many do not even read the instructions
or do not understand them even when they read them.

ned, 1. lip 2025. u 19:15 General and sales enquiries

Hi igo fanatic,  Our PlusX products will arrive at our Hamburg, Germany warehouse in the next few days, and orders within Europe will start shipping from there. By the way, do you have an idea of the typical cost to maintain a Discord community? And how is MOZA currently managing their community operations?

sorry I didn't answer, I was on a trip.

I don't know how much others pay for discord maintenance. In my opinion, a
realistic price for someone to follow discord and commit to it when it
arrives would be €1000 per month. Personally, I would never do it for less.

About MOZA now zero info, as I said, because I haven't taken their products
and I'm not interested in them in the future.

čet, 5. lip 2025. u 09:30 service@simsonn.com
Hi igo fanatic,  If we were to collaborate on Discord, what would be your estimated fee for maintaining support for the SIMSONN brand?

Hi

In order to do it properly, you would have to send me the equipment you
have, so that I can test it, drive races, see the technical specifications,
and of course if we were to continue the cooperation later with each new
product, I would have to do the testing and have it available, so that I
could be adequately prepared and give advice to people who have problems.
Would also have to familiarize with the app that supports the hardware in
detail. because most of the user's questions are related to software.

The products you would send me would remain in my ownership, and the
monthly fee for being present on discord would be €1200.
I would try to be on discord as much as possible, because I work from home,
otherwise it's my job. And it's not a problem for me to follow what needs
to be helped from the side on discord. Of course I would also be away from
home, but considering the time in the EU, I would try to help when I arrive
and when I am not at home.

Would add something. I don't have a classic rig. Have a desktop rig. But
everything is fixed to the table and to the floor. I have a top-notch chair
on wheels, but I also have a stop behind the wheels that is screwed into
the floor. That my experience could potentially also be useful to some
users who may not dare to buy this kind of equipment, because they think
they can't install it on their table.
I also do 3D printing, privately. So design various objects in 3D program
and print what need. Have some things printed in 3D for sim equipment that
used before, but also now at the moment.

Otherwise, I am very long in the sim racing world. let's say that I started
more seriously some 20 years ago with the rfactor1 game, on Logitech G27. I
have developed into a fast driver over the years and I always try to be
among fast drivers. so I also have a lot of experience as a quality sim
driver. Of course, with so many years I have learned a bit about physics,
and especially in games where telemetry can be used with motec, I also like
to be detailed about it.
In general, I am full of experience and knowledge in general about sim
racing.
